content: We are going to be running a self hosted Zulip instance. We have a community of non technical members. They do not need access to API keys etc. Is there a way to disable or take out the API options on the settings/account-and-privacy page ?
A message was moved here from #general > Help by Alya Abbott.

You mean this box?
Screen-Shot-2022-05-17-at-4.11.33-PM.png

You can potentially fork Zulip and remove that section of the UI. But I think it's likely easier to just tell them to ignore it if they ask questions about it. But I suspect that they'll mostly just move right on past it.

Alex Vandiver said:

You mean this box?
Screen-Shot-2022-05-17-at-4.11.33-PM.png
Thanks so much for your help !!!
By any chance would you know where I could make the U.I. changes ? I am a bit technical so could more than likely do it if I know where the changes need to be made.

You can potentially fork Zulip and remove that section of the UI. But I think it's likely easier to just tell them to ignore it if they ask questions about it. But I suspect that they'll mostly just move right on past it.

@Alex Vandiver Thanks so much for your help !!!
By any chance would you know where I could make the U.I. changes ? I am a bit technical so could more than likely do it if I know where the changes need to be made.
By any chance does anyone know where I could make the U.I. changes ? I am a bit technical so could more than likely do it if I know where the changes need to be made.

https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/overview/contributing.html#your-first-codebase-contribution will be a useful reference in general.

https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/95a2b580a0206ef2377acf1d9e74c23e2e3475a9/static/templates/settings/account_settings.hbs#L76-L94 are the relevant lines.
